alert.note: Alert for Burnett (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 24 at 1:52AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Washburn and southeastern Burnett Counties through 230 AM CDT... At 152 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hertel, or 13 miles southwest of Spooner, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Spooner around 215 AM CDT. Trego around 220 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Birch Island Lake and Mckenzie Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
